intro: Cardamine pratensis var. matthioli, commonly known as the purple crowfoot, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and they bloom in early spring. The species is often found in calcareous soils and is considered a relatively rare and localized plant.
